intro: Oxydectes triangularis, commonly known as the triangular spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
